article.title: Dia_%28software%29
article.paragraph: Primary sourcesDecember 2009Infobox softwareDia [[Image:Dia logo.jpg|100px]][[Image:Dia.svg|100px]] [[Image:Dia 0.97 - Flowchart example.png|300px|]] Dia 0.97 in [[Norwegian language|Norwegian]] on [[Windows Vista]] Dia developers 0.97.2https://wiki.gnome.org/Apps/Dia/0.97.3http://ftp.gnome.org/pub/gnome/sources/dia/0.97/dia-0.97.3.news {{release date and age|2011|12|18}} {{release date and age|2014|09|05}} [[C (programming language)|C]] [[Unix-like]], [[Microsoft Windows|Windows]], [[Mac OS]] [[Diagramming software]] [[GNU General Public License|GPL]] [http://wiki.gnome.org/Apps/Dia/ wiki.gnome.org/Apps/Dia/] DiaIPAc-enˈdiːəcite webhttp://wiki.gnome.org/Apps/Dia/FaqDia Frequently Asked Questions2008-08-12isfree and open source softwarefree and open sourcegeneral-purposediagramming software, developed originally by Alexander Larsson. Dia uses a controlledsingle document interface(SDI) similar toGIMPandInkscape.
article.heading: Features
article.paragraph: Dia has a modular design with several shape packages available for different needs:flowchart,Computer network diagramnetwork diagrams,circuit diagrams, and more. It does not restrict symbols and connectors from various categories from being placed together.

Dia has special objects to help drawentity-relationship models(obsoletedtedia2sqlor newerparsediasqlcan be used to create the SQL DDL),Unified Modeling Language(UML) diagrams,flowcharts, network diagrams, and simple electrical circuits. It is also possible to add support for new shapes by writing simpleExtensible Markup LanguageXMLfiles, using a subset ofScalable Vector Graphics(SVG) to draw the shape.

Dia loads and saves diagrams in a custom XML format which is, by default,gzippedto save space. It can print large diagrams spanning multiple pagescite webhttp://www.ohloh.net/p/diaDiaohlohGeeknet, Inc.2010-05-30and can also be scripted using thePython (programming language)Python programming language.
article.heading: Exports
article.paragraph: Dia can export diagrams to various formats including the following:

list.listitem: Computer Graphics MetafileCGM(Computer Graphics Metafile defined byISO standards)

article.heading: Development
article.paragraph: Dia was originally created by Alexander Larsson but he moved on to work onGNOMEand other projects. James Henstridge then took over as the lead developer, but he also moved on to other projects. He was followed by Cyrille Chepelov and Lars Rder Clausen in turn.
Dia is maintained by a group of developers: Hans Breuer, Steffen Macke, and Sameer Sahasrabuddhe.
Dia is written in C, and has an extension system, which also supports writing extensions inPython (programming language)Python.
article.heading: See also

list.listitem: ATLAS Transformation LanguageDia diagrams may be generated by ATL model transformations
